website_summaries.verdict: This is a nice alternative to a traditional Suunto compass that allows you to keep your hands free.
pros: Compact compass that fits comfortably on your wrist
Has a ratchet mechanism for setting a direction and a side reading window
Screen glows for easy night readings
cons: Some find the small compass hard to read
The wrist strap is made from plastic and hook-and-loop tape, which some say doesn't hold up well

customer_reviews.title: A "Meh" for Military Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought thing with the intent of eliminating bothersome lensatic compass checks on the move in a tactical setting, but two things were lacking: 1. The reverse numbering system seems good, but when you are tired from running off two hours sleep it just confuses you. 2. Impossible to read in the dark. Doesn't glow in a way that's helpful for actually reading your azimuth. Also the fact that the north seeking arrow is red makes red lense flashlights unhelpful for a quick compass check. All in all: meh. Save your money and get a basic NSEW, wrist compass that attaches to your wristwatch. It's more helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Moose’s Human

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage, worth $5, not $25
customer_reviews.text: Cheap garbage compass with a cheap uncomfortable velcro strap. It works if you hold it completely level, and even then you have to keep tapping it. the face is tiny, like 1.25 inch diameter. The velcro strap is uncomfortable and cheap. This would be fine for a 1 time throwaway $3-$5 compass, but not a $25 one.
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: It becomes a good conversation piece when I explain that it's a compass
customer_reviews.text: Have had this compass for years now as far of my edc. I wear this compass on my right hand with the watch on my left. Functionally it's balances and snaps right to north quickly without any issues. I have thrown out the strap it comes with and put it on a colorful nato strap, and I get more compliments on the compass than the g-shock I have on my left hand. They don't even notice the g-shock and assume that the compass is a watch. It becomes a good conversation piece when I explain that it's a compass.
customer_reviews.author: Jas Key

customer_reviews.title: Not worth anything.
customer_reviews.text: The needle sticks a lot, even on a flat glass table with no metal around. I have a small $2 compass that is vastly superior to this in accuracy and quality. I was hoping to use this with my lensatic compass to keep me on course while hiking. If you shake it and play with it a bit while keeping it perfectly level you can get accuracy within 30 degrees or so. (not my idea of useful) As soon as you hold it, you realize it is super lightweight and of poor quality. I honestly can not think of a good use for this except to fill the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: David Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: not level
customer_reviews.text: the compass must interact with two forces: magnetic and gravitational. something is wrong with the gravity part, as in the floating part is not counterbalanced such that it does not want to be level. or to rephrase: the only way for the floating part to be parallel with the clear outer case is when the entire assembly is NOT level with the ground. manufacturing defect????
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Not for EDC, ok for Ultralight
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an EDC option— something that could live on my wrist permanently. The bezel is cheap plastic, the band is ultra low quality. For $25 kinda underwhelming. It seems accurate, and insouciant want something ultralight it might be a good option
customer_reviews.author: AJF

customer_reviews.title: Defective, points backwards
customer_reviews.text: It is pointing backwards. 0/360 is pointing South instead of North.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: If Cammenga had made their tritium wrist compass with bearings I would have bought it but the glow-in-the-dark on this compass is good, the bearings and sight picture are great
customer_reviews.text: This compass is actually larger than my normal sized watch but I didn't want a clip-on that could fall off. Some reviewers have complained how level you need to keep it. It really has to be within 5 degrees of flat or it doesn't work. If Cammenga had made their tritium wrist compass with bearings I would have bought it but the glow-in-the-dark on this compass is good, the bearings and sight picture are great, and the size is a positive/negative.
customer_reviews.author: DrFred

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is supposed to but don't like the velcro strap which catches on things and found ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to but don't like the velcro strap which catches on things and found the compass counter intuitive because when looking down on the flat card all the degree markings are 180 degrees out. It is actually designed for taking and following a bearing which it does well, but if you regularly use a Sliva style orienteering compass it takes getting used to. If I was was buying another wrist compass I would pay a bit more for a bigger one that had degree marking on a separate plane for taking bearings so that I could read directions esaily off the card from above as well.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Higgins

customer_reviews.title: very  disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. i have had better out of a Cracker Jack box. For me it felt more like a childs toy than a usable compass. Sad to say not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Daffyduck777

customer_reviews.title: Great compass, terrible strap.
customer_reviews.text: I would like to give this 5 stars but the strap is terrible. Suunto makes a great compass, I have several but I'm really disappointed in the strap. I ended up putting it on a military watch band that has a cover over the compass. I'm surprised that Suunto would do something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I've purchased for racing and general adventures!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent compass. So easy and quick to check your bearing. Settles fast. Use this for adventure racing and it saves so much time being on my wrist. Adventure racing has two critial elements.. keeping track of time and keeping track of direction. This lives on my right wrist for instant hands free use..and a watch on my left wrist.
customer_reviews.author: PXTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Cute but you wont reach shore ever
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. Band is horrible. It does look super cute and glows in the dark, but wont take me North. I'll be lost in the woods, ocean or anyplace with a cute compass. My life could depend on it.. buy a more expensive compass
customer_reviews.author: A Friend

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent compass. The size is
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent compass. The size is, excellent for use in hiking or general direction finding. The card is luminous and is quite visible to dark adapted eyes. While not as precise as a lensatic compass, this is excellent for general hiking. Light weight, compact and quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist compass
customer_reviews.text: Everything works and am very happy with it. The supplied wrist strap was too big for me. I used a Nato watch strap instead. I only wish that the "cage" holding the compass module would be made of aluminium / brass instead of plastic. If I happen to accidentally bash my arm against something, the plastic lugs attaching it to the watch strap will surely break. I'd give it 5 stars if the "cage" is made of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth LEE WM

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of leaving poor reviews. With that said, I was very hopeful for this but it did not work at all. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Two nighttime problems: Noisy Display and Faint Luminescence
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for night use but returned it because I experienced two problems immediately. First, the display is quite "noisy" (too many indicators) and more suited for daytime use on a map laid on a tabletop. Secondly, the luminescent dial's illumination results in a fuzzy and weak display. I'll probably have to go to a tritium display to get what I want - a simple nighttime compass.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kersey

customer_reviews.title: great compass
customer_reviews.text: its a easy to use quick to wear watch just one strap to put on it and then bam ready to go its headings were true to what i know with all other compass units i have along with my knowledge of true north.
customer_reviews.author: William Mikan III

customer_reviews.title: Great for a peek
customer_reviews.text: Use in winter, outside of very thick sleeve or its not going to fit. Summer use is out of the question. Keep it completely flat, level and it will do the job. Nothing to brag about for sure. But for the price, i will get some use out of it
customer_reviews.author: Fair honest reviewer

customer_reviews.title: nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Strap holes are too thin and seem fragile, cannot attach the compass to my watch band. It's really nice looking and easy to read, hope it lasts long.
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product...
customer_reviews.text: I ended up getting a regular flat map compass.... not sure exactly how this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Lila Baker

customer_reviews.title: North at 180!
customer_reviews.text: The compress works fine, but depending on your use, could be worthless as the markings show North at 180 instead of “0” degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Slow and inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: I had seen this promoted as a good compass for trail runners. It’s not. If you raise your wrist in front of you the compass requires up to five seconds to settle. Then it moves around 20 to 30 degrees in various directions as you run. It could really only be used if one were perfectly still. Lesson learned. I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Willson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use this as my primary Compass when I’m in the woods but if you want to do a quick check on your azimuth you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: The compass works well but one of the plastic pieces ...
customer_reviews.text: The compass works well but one of the plastic pieces that holds the band on broke the first day out I then carried t in my pocket. I have cheaper compass's that are tougher.
customer_reviews.author: Trail Boss

customer_reviews.title: Good compass for keeping general direction
customer_reviews.text: Seems as accurate as any other quality compass, as long as you keep away from other metals/phones etc.. Bought a Marathon watch band 20mm WW005003 to go with it, and it fit perfectly. Keep it level when using, and it will work fine - I think it only takes a second or two to settle, which doesn't really bother me. I like the sight as you look across it from the back.
customer_reviews.author: Jef F

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this for military land nav purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for army land nav, realizing 180 is North on this wrist compass after tried to dead recon a 1700m point.
customer_reviews.author: ZJ

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my husband that hikes and hints and he is very pleased with it. Much easier to use since it is a wrist band VERY PLEASED!!
customer_reviews.author: scarlet

customer_reviews.title: Dont get lost
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to what I was in the search for. Compact and wearable. It's easy to read day and night. I use it on my hiking trips, just loop it on my backpack and ready!
customer_reviews.author: The guy from that thing

customer_reviews.title: Need to PADI Advanced Open Water or equivalent SCUBA class
customer_reviews.text: Useful for my advanced open water class and navigation part of dives!
customer_reviews.author: G82G

customer_reviews.title: Great compass but very weak/cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this wrist compass TWICE and the plastic part which attaches to the band/wrist strap broke on both of them within a couple weeks. Great compass but very weak/cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: d simpson

customer_reviews.title: Fast compass checks- Extremely Durable
customer_reviews.text: Wore this the ENTIRE time I was in Ranger school. It never broke! It’s really great for a fast compass check on the move but not a replacement for a real tritium lensatic compass. NOTE: you must hold it completely level to get a good read. Lightweight and well made
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Suunto is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: I love this compass, I've used one before on deployment, and it was always easy to read, and so very convenient. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it if you aren't comfortable with compasses to begin with. It's not very tall, so it needs to be read flat, and you must always have good directional awareness with a wrist compass. I'm using this one I just bought as a dive compass, and it works great underwater too! Not as precise as your larger scuba compasses that cost 3x the price
customer_reviews.author: Jandref

customer_reviews.title: Buy a big display compass always
customer_reviews.text: Is very small and hard to see the bearing with some of the underwater darkness. The sphere doesn't have space to turn freely and if doesn't stay perfectly horizontal don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Manzano

customer_reviews.title: Good little wrist compass
customer_reviews.text: Good little wrist compass, but the strap is scratchy and not comfortable. It's best worn over a jacket or swapping it out for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Archaeocat

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality bearing and plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, clip overly thin hard plastic (seems susceptible to breaking), bearing allows needle to spin only when perfectly level. Execution poorly suited to wrist compass and not befitting Suunto quality.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useless really just buy a real compass
customer_reviews.text: Pretty useless really just buy a real compass. Kind of a pain to get level enough to get a direction.
customer_reviews.author: Will Carter

customer_reviews.title: Value buy! Would reccomend.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has held up from daily military deployed use. Has stood up to bumss and bangs in and out of aircraft, vehicles, and physical training. 9 months of use and the band is starting to fray on the edges. Nothing a lighter can't fix however, eventually will need a replacement. Less bulky than the Garmin Foretrex if all you require is cardinal directions.
customer_reviews.author: bfelts1ak

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have used these compasses on and off for years. I’m in the military and use them for a quick azimuth check while patrolling. I also use them for hunting in thick brush or swampy areas where there is no cell service and walking in a straight line is a must. This guy won’t let you down.
customer_reviews.author: American Jedi

customer_reviews.title: I dont recommend
customer_reviews.text: It is not working very good , i think it was a mistske to buy this model of compass
customer_reviews.author: Badea Nicolae

customer_reviews.title: Wrist compass for the advanced scout
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend who is a surveyor and carries a Suunto compass into the field. I am an amateur rock hound. Occasionally I go for a hike in the mountains. I like to determine my compass bearings. This is the instrument to do it with. Andrew B.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Stays on my work bag.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I keep it on my every day work bag.
customer_reviews.author: cjd720

customer_reviews.title: Wish I hadn't lost it.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing compass, if you're ROTC, it is a must have. If I hadn't lost mine at camp I'd still be using it for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but works
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made but for the price, what can you expect
customer_reviews.author: cody curry

customer_reviews.title: Great for quickly checking your barring
customer_reviews.text: Great back up when I am out camping it takes the place of my watch and my watch goes in my bag
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I wear 24/7 over 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Terrific all around. I wear it 24/7 only reason I bought a new ione is because gave old one to my cuz. Luminating is great and last a great time. recharge it with a flash light for 10 seconds or so and it'll glow cca 4 hours. Suunto pretty much invented the modern compass and is a class act. T)
customer_reviews.author: TiO   T)

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work in the Southern Hemisphere, but does the job in the north
customer_reviews.text: It is cheap looking but hey it's something for outdoors so you won't have to worry about damaging something valuable. It honestly doesn't respond as smoothly to changes in orientation like non wrist compasses I've used before. The dial tends to stick a bit on the plastic covering it sits inside. So I'd say it's fine for basic NESW orientation but not precise navigation.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. W. Waters

customer_reviews.title: A sense of direction
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and read. I think more people should wear these. When the cacao hits the fan, I'll know where I am.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy Metal Chef

customer_reviews.title: What you see a'int what you get
customer_reviews.text: First, I love this wrist compass. The picture advertised shows a white background. The one I got has a very dark background, dark numbers and arrows. Extremely hard to read without glasses and a flashlight. This one is useless junk. The one pictured, perfect. Very loyal amazonite, but really feel ripped off on this one!!!
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The compass is accurate. Other than that, all I can say is that the case feels very cheaply made. Any strike or bump on this thing and I think it is gonna be broken. The strap is complete junk and the strap holders on the case are a little narrow so good luck putting this on a better quality watch strap.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great Compass
customer_reviews.text: Very good wrist compass. The velcro band it comes with to use as a wrist band is ok but, I made a paracord survival bracelet with mine. Most of the compasses at the hobby store are toys and not for serious land navigation. This compass has features that I like and use each time I go afield.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful in the fog and night excursions
customer_reviews.text: A convenient piece of equipment, just as I wear a watch, it's there when I need it. Very little weight with a suppressed needle and clear dial, it travels everywhere I paddle. Extremely useful in the fog and night excursions.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great back up compass
customer_reviews.text: This my second on of these. Lost my last one somewhere and had to get another. These are great for backup or to check your heading without digging out your main compass. Very convenient & much better than smaller compasses it ball compasses. It even has a sight so you can shoot your bearing to your next waypoint.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great Compass
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to beat a suunto M-9 as a backup compass. There are a lot of wrist worn compasses out there and they just do not even come close to the quality of the suunto M-9. I have used Suunto products for a number of years now and really like them. 06012016 Just got another one and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I bought two
customer_reviews.text: Perfect wrist compass Glows really well with a light charge Super simple tool
customer_reviews.author: Zebulawn

customer_reviews.title: Great for patrolling when you don't want to pull out ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for patrolling when you don't want to pull out the clunky green lensatic all the time. But, you need to get used to the way it reads azimuths, because it looks backwards. But I never had problems with it on patrol or during land nav courses. If you need a precise azimuth, definitely use the lensatic compass though.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Gulick

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for sis-in-law for Christmas. She is a diver and she said it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Compact, light and great function
customer_reviews.text: Great add on piece of kit as primary or as a back up to your primary compass.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Von Herring

customer_reviews.title: ... to get lost (not very often anyway) We would recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I used this when we visited any new city to help us not to get lost (not very often anyway) We would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Olson

customer_reviews.title: It just OK
customer_reviews.text: It is ok Seems overpriced. Hard to read quickly while MTB. Just started using it. I hope to get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sregnif Naloof

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Delivered quickly and is exactly what I wanted a basic low profile compass for diving. This is an earlier model compass without the bells and whistles of a more expensive and higher profile unit. If you are looking for a basic diving compass this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: skidoctor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice wrist compass
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wrist compass. Do not be concerned that E shows 180 degrees and W 90 degrees when you look down at it. The degrees are all correct when you look through the small side window.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compass
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dive compass. Small, easy to put on. I loved it. I dive nights. This compass is a must. Loved it. The least expensive wrist compass I can find . Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hung Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Functional product
customer_reviews.text: Very basic product, but very functional. I absolutely hate the Velcro strap, but made my own band from 550 cord
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product. Smaller than expected but that’s my fault
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, great product. Smaller than expected but that’s my fault. Item was properly described and seller was amazing
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The size is perfect, the case appears a little on the little ...
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect, the case appears a little on the little duty side (only time will tell), love the side window for bearing view and liquid damping is very good.
customer_reviews.author: DenSob

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: So first of all they sent me the wrong compass. After I did get the right one I realized the degrees are flipped and inaccurate. Janky and poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: ... compass for my husband and his loves it and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I got this compass for my husband and his loves it and easy to read
customer_reviews.author: Bab

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this all of the time. It replaced my primary for most things.
customer_reviews.author: dana lee pomeroy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best all-round wrist compasses
customer_reviews.text: Suunto quality. I like the sighting feature which is useful and surprisingly good in a wrist compass.
customer_reviews.author: Leitz

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. Price was good and shipment was fast
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Price was good and shipment was fast. I got this compass as backup. Seems to be very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: MaxFox

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters...
customer_reviews.text: The dial is quite large, but I could live with this, but the band will fit me and my wife...both at the same time, it's quite long, so you may need to replace the band.
customer_reviews.author: WLA127

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quick small easy to carry compass to guide ones way.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Light and effective
customer_reviews.text: This is the most practical of compasses. Very light on the wrist and independent of electronics or satellites. It would have been more useful than the Garmin GPS I struggled with last month in Edinburgh.
customer_reviews.author: Howard in Berkeley

customer_reviews.title: I haven't put it to the test yet
customer_reviews.text: We're taking a trip to Southeast Asia and wanted to have a compass in case we travel somewhere unfamiliar and need to get out! I'm embarrassed to say that the directions were hard to figure out. I wasn't sure how to use the compass. I had to watch you Tube videos for help! But in the end I made sense of it. Also, the strap, as simple as it is, should have had directions as well. I'm hoping to put it to the test in a few weeks. The price was right.
customer_reviews.author: LikeToShopOnLine

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and accurate
customer_reviews.text: A little on the large side but works very well. Used this on a couple of day hikes and it has provided me with reliable and accurate directional information. Strap is 22mm so you can easily swap it with a nylon Zulu or NATO.
customer_reviews.author: Tsarli

customer_reviews.title: I'll never be lost again!
customer_reviews.text: The compass arrived in good shape and in a timely way. I prefer wrist a wrist compass over a military style model, because I find it is easier to use quickly. This product is easier to read and has better features than the 20 year model it replaces.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Settles quickly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my cheaper Coleman model failed in 2 degree F weather. Settles quickly. I'm very happy with this compass so far.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W. Broughton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very useful land nav item. Easy to read. fast for dead reckoning
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Legit compass.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, small, adaptable to wear in many ways. Get two!
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Too small...regrettably..
customer_reviews.text: Liked it online but regrettably too shallow and tends to stick on headings. Also I had to give up on it as the numbers are just too small for my old eyes..even with water magnification.. Supplier shipped quickly..
customer_reviews.author: ngw

customer_reviews.title: great p[roduct:
customer_reviews.text: A good quality product! It is handy and useful! Though the strap could have been made shorter!
customer_reviews.author: Upstate Newyorker

customer_reviews.title: ... only used it once so far but it looks great & works great
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once so far but it looks great & works great. I've got no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S

customer_reviews.title: This rocks
customer_reviews.text: Slim and light but works. Very convenient, and the entire card face is luminous. However, I recommend replacing the strap with a non-velcro version (uses a 20mm size).
customer_reviews.author: prepper10

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wrist compass. My only issue is I hate wearing watches, so why did I buy this?
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Too slow
customer_reviews.text: Slow response, low stability. Good window to look the grades.
customer_reviews.author: @turnerodemar

customer_reviews.title: Quality, affordable wrist mounted convenience
customer_reviews.text: Nice, affordable, convenience of always being within sight. Too bad I lost mine after two outings. Will have to get a replacement soon.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Ridge

customer_reviews.title: Great product for navigating through a strange city
customer_reviews.text: I used this wrist compass successfully on a recent tour of Scandinavia, and it helped me find my way several times. It has the very nice feature of settling down quickly to a specific orientation. It's also a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Corwin

customer_reviews.title: Love Suunto. Reliable compass to wear while hunting
customer_reviews.text: Love Suunto. Reliable compass to wear while hunting. Did not like the band that came with it and replaced it with a Marathon watch band.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Mitchel

customer_reviews.title: Suunto M-9 Wrist Compass
customer_reviews.text: Great quality wrist compass. Has a view window and small sighting notch. Wrist band is cheap, but can be replaced easily. I never go hiking without it.
customer_reviews.author: Trent R. Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose your way !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product @ a great price. I wear mine all the time. I like mine so much I bought a second as a gift. Don't leave home without it!!!
customer_reviews.author: moe

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my adventurous husband who absolutely loves it. People often do ask why he is wearing two watches because unless your close, you wouldn't notice that it's a compass.:)
customer_reviews.author: M. Slana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and expected, and the product got to my house quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hambz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should, inexpensive price point, yes it's plastic but again, not expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great compass
customer_reviews.text: Was using a Garmin 401 GPS digital compass feature, but helicopters throw off the calibration (imagine my surprise stepping off a Blackhawk and my Garmin 401 compass has me turning in circles). So I bought this and mounted it to the strap of the Garmin 401. Now I have an accurate compass and can read my grid location, bearing, and distance, and use the compass to adjust my heading accurately, all by taking only a moment to glance at my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: I am firefighter and I use it in a daily ...
customer_reviews.text: I am firefighter and I use it in a daily basis under a variety of hard conditions. Also, I road in my bike, run and many other activities and in the mountain the compass work without any detectable problem. Only one thing: I changed the wrist band and now have it a NATO watch strap.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. Got a chums strap. The one included is fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Kibu

customer_reviews.title: Every JTAC needs one
customer_reviews.text: It keeps you orientated on the move. It is very helpful for adjusting fire and building your SA. Simple and almost fail proof.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: What more could you want in a wrist compass? Well, a better rotating bezel for starters, and more clearance between the needle arms and the plastic cover (unless you hold it perfectly level, the needle has a habit of resting against the clear plastic cover and not moving). On the plus side it was cheap and has minimal bulk. I wish I'd gone for a more expensive, easier to use compass.
customer_reviews.author: Global_Roaming

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than it looks
customer_reviews.text: Used the whole fire season in the mountains. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: alann chase ryan

product_meta.title: Suunto M-9 w/Velcro Strap Compass
feature_bullets: Handy and reliable wrist compass for navigating around town or the country
Employs Suunto's two-zone system for reliable readings in northern hemisphere
Serrated bezel ring turns easily even when you're wearing gloves
Ratchet mechanism for setting direction; jewel bearing and side reading window
